name: Antipasto
instructions: Use a long platter, and arrange salami, provolone, tomato, onion, red peppers, and anchovies.
Put the baby corns and olives in the center of the tray.
Cut celery sticks and arrange them between each antipasti.
Sprinkle some salt lightly on everything.
Drizzle olive oil on everything.
Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

name: Basic Polenta
instructions: Bring water to a boil in a large pot. Add salt and reduce heat to a simmer.
Add cornmeal slowly to avoid lumps, stirring constantly.
Cook, stirring constantly, for 20 to 30 minutes until thick.
Pour polenta onto a large board and smooth out evenly.
Let cool and solidify. Cut into slices and serve.

name: Tomato Bruschetta
instructions: Toast the bread under the broiler until lightly browned.
Combine garlic and olive oil and brush over one side of the bread.
Spread tomatoes over the bread.
Sprinkle with salt and pepper.
Broil for about 30 seconds to heat the tomatoes.
Sprinkle with basil and serve.

name: Fettucini Romano Ala Fratelli
instructions: Add olive oil to a hot pan. Add garlic and sauté over high heat for about 1 minute.
Add wine and simmer for about 2 minutes.
Add half-and-half and bring back to a simmer.
Add Romano cheese and stir until smooth.
Add the pasta to the pan and toss until coated.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve.

name: Calamari Imbottiti
instructions: Clean squid, remove eyes, outside skin, and intestines.
Combine onion, raisins, bread crumbs, parsley, Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper.
Fill the cavity of each squid with the stuffing and secure with toothpicks.
Prepare the sauce: brown garlic in oil, mash tomatoes, and add. Simmer for 10 minutes.
Place squid in baking dish, cover with sauce, and bake at 400°F for 35 minutes.

name: Focaccia Versiliese
instructions: Stir yeast into warm water and let proof for 10 minutes.
Stir in olive oil, rosemary, sage, olives, and garlic.
Mix in flours and salt to form a thick dough.
Knead for 8 to 10 minutes, then let rise until doubled.
Stretch the dough into an oiled baking pan and let half-rise for 30 minutes.
Dimple the top, sprinkle with salt and olive oil, and bake at 400°F for 25 to 30 minutes.

name: Eggplant Parmigiana
instructions: Dip eggplant slices in eggs, then in bread crumbs seasoned with salt and pepper.
Refrigerate for 20 minutes.
In a large saucepan, sauté garlic in 2 tablespoons oil for 1-2 minutes.
Remove garlic and add tomatoes, tomato paste, basil, salt, and pepper.
Cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 350°F.
Brown eggplant in 1/4-inch oil in a large skillet.
Drain on paper towels.
Put a thin layer of tomato sauce into a baking dish and layer eggplant, sauce, Parmesan, and mozzarella alternately.
End with mozzarella on top.
Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
